name: frost
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 [ U ] the thin, white layer of ice that forms when the air temperature is below the freezing point of water, especially outside at night: When I woke up this morning, the ground was covered with frost.
Maisie Paterson/The Image Bank/GettyImages
B2 [ C or U ] a weather condition in which the air temperature falls below the freezing point of water, especially outside at night: There was a frost last night.hard frost There were a lot of hard (= severe) frosts that winter.heavy frost Heavy (= severe) frosts ended our hopes of a good harvest.
More examplesFewer examplesLook, the frost has made a beautiful pattern on the window.There was a heavy frost last night and the ground is still hard.These plants are particularly susceptible to frost.In a normal winter, the frost penetrates deeply enough to kill off insect eggs in the soil.Gardeners need to be prepared for several severe frosts in the next month or two.
